name: Mailing Test
subject: Test Mailing
html:
New from eLife
January 1, 1970
Recent articles Sign up for alerts About eLife For authors

The following articles have been accepted for publication by eLife and released in the last seven days. To help make important findings publicly available as soon as possible, we offer authors the option to make a PDF of their manuscript available within a few days of acceptance, prior to proofing and processing.

This alert is sent once a week. To be notified immediately when new manuscripts are available, please subscribe to the RSS feed. Subscribe to eLife Content Alerts to receive news of all eLife content, including the final versions of all the research articles, expert commentaries, podcast interviews, and more.

Accepted manuscripts

Divergent kleisin subunits of cohesin specify mechanisms to tether and release meiotic chromosomes
Aaron F Severson, Barbara J Meyer
PDF | Additional files

Ecology and evolution of viruses infecting uncultivated SUP05 bacteria as revealed by single-cell- and meta- genomics
Simon Roux, Alyse K Hawley, Monica Torres Beltran, Melanie Scofield, Patrick Schwientek, Ramunas Stepanauskas, Tanja Woyke, Steven J Hallam, Matthew B Sullivan
PDF | Additional files

Identification of the transcription factor ZEB1 as a central component of the adipogenic gene regulatory network
Carine Gubelmann, Petra C Schwalie, Sunil K Raghav, Eva Röder, Tenagne Delessa, Elke Kiehlmann, Sebastian M Waszak, Andrea Corsinotti, Gilles Udin, Wiebke Holcombe, Gottfried Rudofsky, Didier Trono, Christian Wolfrum, Bart Deplancke
PDF | Additional files

For the media

Your contact is Jennifer Mitchell: press@elifesciences.org, +44 (0)1223855373. Please cite eLife as the source of these articles and include a link to either the article or elifesciences.org. Thank you! More details available at http://elifesciences.org/for-the-press.

To be notified of new content at eLife, sign up at http://crm.elifesciences.org/crm/civicrm/profile/create?reset=1&gid=24.

eLife XML is available at Github.

Thanks for subscribing to receive alerts from eLife, the new journal for the very best in life science and biomedical research, supported by the Howard Hughes Medical Institute, the Max Planck Society, and the Wellcome Trust. If you have any questions or comments, feel free to contact us.

© eLife Sciences Publications Ltd,
subject to CC-BY license
ISSN – 2050–084X

eLife Sciences Publications Ltd.
1st Floor, 24 Hills Road,
Cambridge CB2 1JP

New from /eLife/
*January 1, 1970*

Recent articles [2]
                 Sign up for alerts [3]
                 About eLife [4]
                 For authors [5]
The following articles have been accepted for publication by /eLife/ and 
released in the last seven days. To help make important findings publicly 
available as soon as possible, we offer authors the option [6] to make a 
PDF of their manuscript available within a few days of acceptance, prior to 
proofing and processing.

This alert is sent once a week. To be notified immediately when new 
manuscripts are available, please subscribe to the RSS feed [7]. 
Subscribe to eLife Content Alerts [8] to receive news of all /eLife/ content, 
including the final versions of all the research articles, expert 
commentaries, podcast interviews, and more.

*Accepted manuscripts*

Aaron F Severson, Barbara J Meyer

Ecology and evolution of viruses infecting uncultivated SUP05 bacteria as

Sullivan

For the media

To be notified of new content at eLife, sign up at

Thanks for subscribing to receive alerts from eLife, the new journal for the
